channel.title: [WinApps]Run Windows programs in Linux! (And a list of working applications)
channel.description:
This is not like WinE or WineX, after you install the program, it gives you a list of Windows applications. Things like Shockwave (yes, Shockwave on Linux), to Adobe Photoshop, Windows Media Player, and a lot of other things.
So when you choose the application you would like to install, click next, and install it. I'm pretty sure it installs it to your C:\ drive, and then Linux runs it off that.
This thing is just plain awesome, the only thing I have installed so far is Shockwave. So I'm actually playing Shockwave games on Linux. Later I will install Photoshop.
The one thing is, if you want to install a program like Photoshop that requires a CD, you must actually have the CD in order to install it. That doesn't mean you can't download it from a torrent and burn it, though :D.
Enough talk, Torrent (Demonoid): [url=http://www.demonoid.com/files/details/305155/6420025/]http://www.demonoid.com/files/details/305155/6420025/[/url]
Rapidshare: [url=http://rapidshare.de/files/30066912/crossoverofficepro501.zip.html]http://rapidshare.de/files/30066912/crossoverofficepro501.zip.html[/url]
Please list applications you have installed (and post if they work or not), I will post them here:
Adobe Photoshop 7 - Working Adobe Acrobat Reader 5.0 - Working Apple Quicktime - Semi-works (Crossover says install failed, but it works fine) Adobe Shockwave - Working

item.title: [WinApps]Run Windows programs in Linux! (And a list of working applications)
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“nix, post:28, topic:10233”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=14901.msg248118#msg248118 date=1158449895]

Virtual machines don’t work with sound or video drivers (Besides generics). I hope you enjoy your soundless and software-rendered games!

well ur not meant to play games in a vm anyway lol.
this is for discussingg apps such as visual studo, macromedia studio, etc

Ok, that’s fine. But what if you want to play games on Linux (Ex. you dont have Windows at all).
[/quote]linux isnt meant for games its meant for coders/hosts/open source whores[/quote]
No, it’s pretty much meant for what ever I want to do with it. It just happens to be good for those 3 things.

Read full topic

you download it thry torrent

And I haven’t actually used a VM so I’m curious, but wouldn’t actually running XP on a VM pose a security risk?
